0: ROME—Pope Francis said the Vatican would study the possibility of ordaining Catholic women as deacons, as part of the church’s efforts to give a greater leadership role to women. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR During a meeting Thursday with leaders of women’s religious orders, the pope—who has frequently lauded the role women play in the church—was asked why the role of permanent deacon was limited to men. The pontiff responded that the Vatican would investigate the possibility of admitting women to the role, without offering further details.
